sense.name: a wide extension of the legs, right-angled to the torso
sense.commentary: SPLIT[+event][+posture][+gymnastic][+extension][+right_angled][+of_legs][+to_torso] Note: usually in the plural form
sense.examples: The gymnast did the splits on the balance beam. Be respectful of your groin muscles when attempting the splits.

sense.name: a half portion of liquor
sense.examples: She had a split of champagne and a slice of angel food cake every night before bedtime. We ordered a split of red table wine to go with our dinner.

sense.name: a given portion of some asset
sense.examples: The robber's split of the bank takings was about 1 million dollars. The playoffs are currently a split with each team having won two games. The partners' split of the proceeds was fifty-fifty.

sense.name: a lengthwise crack in a hard object
sense.examples: John replaced several planks on his wooden deck that had splits in them. The split in the sidewalk was caused by an earthquake. Dietary deficiencies can result in splits in the fingernails.

sense.name: tear or rip in a fabric
sense.examples: There is a split in the seam of this blouse. A beam of sunlight came through a small split in the curtain.

sense.name: an ice cream dessert with fruits and nuts
sense.examples: Mary ordered a banana split. The double split has four scoops of ice cream, chocolate, walnuts, cherries, peaches and whipped cream.

sense.name: division of a group into factions or subunits
sense.examples: The split between rich and poor has gradually decreased in their society. The presence of this third-party candidate has caused a major split in their political party. That species' split from its ancestor occurred about 20 million years ago.

sense.name: a romantic or marital breakup
sense.examples: The Hollywood couple's split was highly publicized. John's painful split from his second wife has made him wary of marriage in general.

sense.name: an increase, usually doubling, of outstanding shared of stock without a change in their equity
sense.examples: Sally's company just had a 1-for-2 stock split. After the split, John owned 400 shares of the firm, not 200. The company has had two reverse splits in the past three years, so Bob went from owning 1000 shares to owning 250 shares.

sense.name: the act of rending, tearing, ripping
sense.examples: The split of the trunk in two by a lightening strike was very dramatic. The dealer's split of the card deck into three parts was very quick.

sense.name: portion of time during a race
sense.examples: Was was the split time of each marathon runner? His split time was better during the first race than during the second.

sense.name: a divided configuration of bowling pins
sense.examples: The pins were split after John's first ball in the tenth frame.
